intro: Marsdenia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, thick stems and opposite, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. Marsdenia rotundifolia is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
